p.s: As written before, the novel Gun Love by Jennifer Clement, published in 2019 is about the story of Pearl and her mother Margot.
Pearl and Margot are living since 14 years in bad conditions in a Mercury in the trailer park in Florida.
Now I want to analyse if the CPSChild Protective Service should have taken Pearl away from Margot, to bring her into a foster home.
On the one Handhand Pearl is everything for Margot, so if you would take her away you take a big part from Margot away.
So that Margot doesn't get happy anymore.
But on the other Handhand Pearl is a very intelligent student and likes to go to school.
She also dreamdreams of finiturefurniture.

So if the CPSChild Protective Service would put her into a foster home she can affortafford her dream of a chair and a desk and she has better oppertunitiesopportunities of getting a good job in the future.
When we have a look on the American Dream you can notice that it is very hard to get in the upper class, when you born in a poor family.
But if Pearl startstarts a new life now her chance of getting a good job with much money is much higher as when she waitwaits until she gets older.
But if you look with another view on this situation you can't be sure if she doesn't like it in the trailer park.
Maybe she loveloves it there and wants to lifelive there forever.
But Pearl is a child she needneeds friends.
She needs to play with others and communicate with more people in her age.
If she goes in a foster home she will make contacts to other children with the same age like her.
And if something would happen to Margot she is safe.
She could live a child life without fear.
In my opinion it would be right, if the CPSChild Protective Service put Pearl into a foster home.
She can lifelive a life with more friends and later she havehas many opportunities for a good job and a good future.
Even Margot would be very sad, I think she wantwants only the best for Pearl and this would be the best in this situation.
